intro: Licania retusa, commonly known as the red-stemmed licania, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems that often have a reddish hue, and its simple, alternate leaves that are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape. It produces small, white to pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Licania retusa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
